Physiological/Pathological: Physiological BBB (tight barrier); can add inflammation or disease states
Cell Source: Human brain endothelial cells + astrocytes, optionally pericytes (primary or iPSC-derived)
Stromal Cells: No traditional stroma; astrocytes act as supporting glia
Circulating Immune: Yes if introduced in flow for transmigration assays
Crosstalk (Multi-tissue): No standard, single BBB unit; could link to neuron chip
Extracellular Matrix: Yes (coating or thin gel, plus membrane for endothelium)
3D Scaffold: Partly 3D arrangement (monolayer + glial compartment), not large 3D tissue
Notable Features: Flow-based shear stress, TEER measurement with AKITA Lid, real-time BBB permeability
Plate/Format (Throughput): AKITA plate in 96 or 384 footprint, ~24–96 BBB units per plate (medium/high)
Readouts - Live Imaging: Yes (confocal for junctions, tracer leakage in real time)
Readouts - Supernatant Sampling: Yes, luminal/abluminal compartments for cytokine or drug analysis
Readouts - Cell Retrieval: Possible by enzymatic removal from channels
Readouts - Whole Tissue: Yes (fix in plate for IF on endothelium/astrocytes)
Perfused: Yes, via AKITA Wave rocker or unidirectional adapter
Real-time Microenvironment Control: Flow rate adjustable, TEER monitored continuously, compound dosing on the fly
model_availability: Product-based (AKITA plate + lid + wave); do-it-yourself with provided protocol

Organs/Tissues: Human bronchial/alveolar epithelium at air-liquid interface
Physiological/Pathological: Physiological mucociliary epithelium or diseased (e.g. inflamed, infected)
Cell Source: Human airway epithelial cells (A549 or primary bronchial cells), optional endothelium
Multiple Cell Types: Yes if co-culture with endothelium or fibroblasts, but base is single epithelial layer
Stromal Cells: No by default, can add fibroblasts for advanced model
Tissue-resident Immune: No by default, can add alveolar macrophages
Circulating Immune: Possible if endothelial layer is present under flow
Crosstalk (Multi-tissue): Not typically, single lung barrier unit
Extracellular Matrix: Yes (membrane coated with ECM proteins, or thin gel)
3D Scaffold: Mostly a 2D monolayer under ALI, though 3D possible with layered structure
Notable Features: Ciliated epithelium, mucus production, TEER measurement, alveolar or bronchial region under flow
Plate/Format (Throughput): AKITA plate (96 or 384) with ~24–96 lung units
Max Culture Duration: Weeks (2–4+) for full differentiation at ALI
Readouts - Live Imaging: Yes (IF for ZO-1, cilia, mucus, real-time imaging possible)
Readouts - Cell Retrieval: Yes (trypsin from membrane, or fix in situ)
Readouts - TEER: Yes, via AKITA Lid for barrier integrity
Dead Volume: Very low (small fluid volumes, ALI on top)
Gas Mix Controlled: Incubator-based, air on top side, 5% CO2 in incubator
Real-time Microenvironment Control: Flow rate, drug addition, aerosol or droplet on apical side, TEER live read
model_availability: Product-based, user establishes ALI culture on AKITA plate

Physiological/Pathological: Physiological microvascular bed or diseased (inflammation, tumor vasculature)
Cell Source: Human endothelial cells (e.g. HUVEC) ± pericytes/fibroblasts for stable network
Multiple Cell Types: Yes typically endothelium + supportive stromal cells
Stromal Cells: Yes (fibroblasts, mesenchymal cells to facilitate vessel formation)
Tissue-resident Immune: No by default, can add immune cells in matrix or flow
Circulating Immune: Yes if introduced in perfusion to test rolling/adhesion
Crosstalk (Multi-tissue): No single chip. Could combine with tumor or organ cells to create vascularized organ model
Air-Liquid Interface: No, fully fluid-filled channels in 3D gel
Extracellular Matrix: Yes (collagen/fibrin gel to embed vessel network)
Notable Features: Perfusable 3D vasculature, bidirectional or unidirectional flow, watch cell adhesion
Plate/Format (Throughput): AKITA 96 or 384, ~24–96 vascular networks in parallel
Max Culture Duration: Days to weeks (maintain flow for stable networks)
Readouts - Live Imaging: Yes (confocal, track vascular morphology, cell infiltration)
Readouts - Supernatant Sampling: Yes (effluent can be analyzed for secreted factors)
Readouts - Cell Retrieval: Possible by digesting gel or flushing out cells
Readouts - Whole Tissue: Yes (fix entire 3D vessel, immunostain for CD31 etc.)
Readouts - TEER: Not standard for random 3D vessels, do permeability tracer assays instead
Dead Volume: Low, microchannels with minimal wasted volume
Perfused: Yes, continuous flow driven by AKITA Wave or adapters
Real-time Microenvironment Control: Flow rate adjustments, injection of cells or drugs in real-time
model_availability: Product-based kit (AKITA Lumen), user self-assembles vessel networks

Organs/Tissues: Human intestinal epithelium + endothelium in microfluidic barrier
Physiological/Pathological: Physiological gut barrier (Caco-2 or primary) for drug absorption; can simulate inflamed or diseased
Cell Source: Caco-2 (standard) or primary/intestine iPSC cells for epithelium, plus microvascular endothelial cells for basolateral side
Stromal Cells: Not by default, can add fibroblasts if needed
Tissue-resident Immune: No, but can add immune cells basolaterally
Circulating Immune: Yes, if included in endothelial channel flow
Crosstalk (Multi-tissue): No single chip; can be linked to other organ chips if desired
Air-Liquid Interface: No (intestinal lumen fluid on top, endothelial side fluid beneath)
Extracellular Matrix: Membrane + ECM coating for cell attachment, 3D gel if advanced co-culture
3D Scaffold: Typically a 2D monolayer, though can incorporate 3D features if desired
Notable Features: Flow-based Caco-2 permeability test, TEER monitoring, simulates oral drug absorption under shear
Plate/Format (Throughput): AKITA plate in 96 or 384 footprint, ~24–96 gut barrier units
Max Culture Duration: Typically ~2–3 weeks to fully differentiate epithelium, can maintain longer
Readouts - Live Imaging: Yes (IF for tight junctions, morphological changes)
Readouts - Supernatant Sampling: Yes (apical or basolateral compartments for drug or biomarker measurement)
Readouts - Cell Retrieval: Yes, from each side of the membrane after experiment
Readouts - Whole Tissue: Yes (fix monolayers on chip, stain for ZO-1, etc.)
Dead Volume: Low microchannel volumes, easy to measure transported drug
Perfused: Yes (basolateral flow, can be bidirectional or unidirectional)
Real-time Microenvironment Control: Flow rate changes, drug additions to apical/luminal side, TEER in real time
model_availability: Product-based (AKITA kit for gut barrier). Lab builds or runs assays
